channel.title: ubuntu on Dan Aukes
channel.description: Recent content in ubuntu on Dan Aukes

item.title: Clone and Setup Custom Workspace
item.description: Steps Clone the idealab repository git clone https://github.com/idealabasu/code_idealab_ros.git Compile

item.title: Configure Git
item.description: git config --global user.email "danaukes@gmail.com" git config --global user.name "Dan Aukes" Update git roscd thorlabs_linear_actuator/ git status git add -A git commit -m="<INSERT YOUR MESSAGE HERE>" git push # supply username and pw

item.title: Create a new message
item.description: Steps Create Message roscd thorlabs_linear_actuator/ mkdir msg cd msg nano write.

item.title: Creating a custom Photon Package
item.description: Introduction These instructions were used to create the photon package. Please see the package in the src directory to see the resulting code and setup

item.title: Creating a new package
item.description: Create a new package ```bash cd ~/code_idealab_ros/src/ catkin_create_pkg thorlabs_linear_actuator std_msgs rospy roscpp cd ~/code_idealab_ros/ catkin_make ``` Find package dependencies:

item.title: Creating Scripts
item.description: Steps see https://wiki.ros.org/ROS/Tutorials/CustomMessagePublisherSubscriber(python) for details on how to customize create the scripts directory and pull talker and listener examples

item.title: CV Bridge and Python 3
item.description: getting cv_bridge working with python 3 is less straightforward. you need to recompile cv_bridge locally.

item.title: Getting the Logitech c930 working with ROS
item.description: Using a USB webcam (with virtualbox) Introduction Making a usb webcam work in Linux AND virtualbox is not as easy as it sounds.

item.title: Getting UVC working with Raspberry Pi
item.description: install uvc stuff. sudo apt update sudo apt install -y libuvc-dev guvcview cheese v4l-utils # sudo apt install uvccapture uvcdynctrl try guvcview or cheese to see if you can see video output(may need to install):

item.title: Installing Algo VPN
item.description: Introduction While this is a bit off topic, it is sometimes necessary to create a virtual network to enable computers across a large distance to communicate as if on the same network.

item.title: Installing and Configuring the default ROS Environment
item.description: This is not necessary if you will be creating your own custom workspace

item.title: Installing and Running the Novint Falcon
item.description: Introduction This tutorial describes how to install and run a Novint falcon in an Ubuntu virtual machine.

item.title: Installing OpenCV
item.description: install opencv for python sudo apt update sudo apt install python3-opencv # may be done already depending on what you installed.

item.title: Installing, Running, and Using RosBridge
item.description: Introduction This section describes installing RosBridge, which is useful for communicating to devices which do not have ROS installed (like windows machines with custom drivers)

item.title: Navigating the Ros Filesystem (optional)
item.description: From here #sudo apt-get install ros-<distro>-ros-tutorials sudo apt-get install ros-melodic-ros-tutorials #rospack find [package_name] rospack find roscpp #roscd [locationname[/subdir]] roscd roscpp #print the working directory using the Unix command pwd #To see what is in your ROS_PACKAGE_PATH, type: echo $ROS_PACKAGE_PATH #roscd can also move to a subdirectory of a package or stack.

item.title: Overview
item.description: Introduction The purpose of this project is to document our implementation of ROS and teach lab members how to use it for a number of purposes specific to the activities of a robotics lab like the IDEAlab.

item.description: Lab instructions for setting up ROS

item.title: Running Ros on a Raspbery Pi 4 with Raspberry Pi OS
item.description: Introduction Installing ROS on a Raspberry Pi 4 is difficult because, though the ubuntu images seem good to go, I experienced unknown problems setting up a headless install of ubuntu 18.

item.title: Setup
item.description: Introduction This section discusses how to prepare a computer for installing ROS.

item.title: Using Arduino with ROS
item.description: Introduction These instructions were for how to create the package from scratch.

item.title: Using the Mark-10
item.description: prep the host machine in a virtualbox environment Download and install drivers from the mark 10 website plug in and turn on mark 10.

item.title: Using the Thorlabs linear stage
item.description: Introduction These instructions are for loading and running the thorlabs linear stage in ROS.
